episodes.title: Is Humor a Crime in Scientology?
episodes.description:
Are Scientologists Afraid of Humor?

Do Scientologists have a sense of humor, or is joking considered a punishable offense? In this video, we explore Scientology’s strict attitude toward humor and why members don't seem to be able to accept jokes—especially about the church.  

Join me as I break down how Scientology suppresses humor, what happens to members who joke too much, and why laughter might just be one of the most powerful weapons against cult control.  

🔔 Subscribe for more insights into Scientology’s hidden world.  
👍 Like if you believe in the power of humor!  
💬 Comment below: Do you think Scientology fears jokes?

episodes.title: Trouble in Paradise: My Conflicts within Scientology
episodes.description:
In this video, I take you through my too-long tenure within the Church of Scientology— and the various times I bucked the system.

This video sheds light on the moments I faced criticism, the times I found myself in trouble, and the instances where I came close to being declared suppressive. 

In the end, I was declared suppressive and (thankfully) kicked out. Join me as I recount the events that shaped my journey and finally allowed me to break free.

Note: Being declared suppressive in Scientology is like the kiss of death for a true believer. You are immediately shunned and cut off from all family, friends, and those associates who remain in Scientology.

🙏 Thank you for watching! Don't forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more content about my life and experiences.

episodes.title: How many Body Thetans does scientology think we have?
episodes.description:
How many Body Thetans does scientology think we have?

I don't think Hubbard thought this through.

"Scientology teaches that we’re all weighed down by countless body thetans—disembodied spirits from a distant galactic catastrophe—that cling to us and mess with our lives. But did L. Ron Hubbard really think through how many there are and how they supposedly were transported here? In this video, we’ll explore these invisible entities and why the entire concept starts to fall apart under closer scrutiny. Join us as we unravel this cornerstone of Scientology’s advanced levels and question the logic behind it all!"

episodes.title: Are We Winning or Losing the Battle against Scientology and Their Abuses?
episodes.description:
Sometimes it feels like we're striking out against an invisible foe. Scientology locks themselves behind closed and locked doors, pulls down their blinds, and almost never tells the truth, especially about their own growth. They brag about all the new buildings but never about new people in their group. They brag about their front groups but never about their Clears and OTs changing things for better in the world. No Clear has ever developed a new technology, or medicine that will improve life. No OT has ever fixed anything with their supposed superhuman abilities, big or small. Scientology seemingly has unlimited funds for their defence as well as building their façade of empty buildings and events, but are limited by their policies to responding as Hubbard dictated.

Our words are our swords, and truth our arrows.

Let’s face it - in a street fight size does matter. In an altercation with a larger opponent, it will be worth knowing how to employ the right offensive and defensive strategies to overcome their height and reach advantage. Assuming you have no other option than to stand and slug it out, you’ll need to be able to wear them down with superior movement and well-placed attacks. This type of situation can be quite intimidating, but if you keep a cool head and make the right moves, you stand a chance at coming out on top.

We can be nimble and make the right moves in our battle with Scientology. We can, and will win.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

episodes.title: Does Scientology Really Work?
episodes.description:
In this video, we dive into the question: Does Scientology really work? We explore the extraordinary promises made by Scientology, from the supposed mental and physical transformations in Dianetics to the supernatural abilities claimed at the highest OT (Operating Thetan) levels. Discover the original promise of OT VIII—mastery over matter, energy, space, and time—and examine whether anyone has actually achieved these powers. We assess whether Scientology’s claims hold up or if they’re just an illusion. Watch, think critically, and join the conversation in the comments below!

We'll delve into the foundation's misleading materials, questionable methods, and how it infiltrates schools and communities under the guise of helping people, all while hiding its ties to the controversial church. episodes.title: Scientology's Facebook Police: Controlling Members Through Social Media
episodes.description:
In this video, we dive into Scientology's disturbing practice of monitoring its members' social media activity through what’s known as the "Facebook Police." These individuals are tasked with scouring the Facebook accounts of fellow Scientologists, watching for any signs of disloyalty or associations with critics, former members, or "Suppressive Persons." This covert surveillance allows Scientology to isolate those who stray from its doctrine, ensuring members remain loyal and disconnected from any outside influence.

Through these tactics, Scientology tightens its grip on followers, restricting their access to open communication and outside perspectives. By instilling fear of being reported and potentially punished, Scientology uses the Facebook Police as just another tool in its arsenal of control and manipulation, keeping members isolated from the truth and firmly under the organization's control.

episodes.title: The Dark Side of Scientology: My Participation in the Guardian's Office Crimes
episodes.description:
Join me as I delve into my past and reveal how I got entangled in the Canadian branch of Scientology's Guardian's Office illegal activities. This candid account covers my recruitment, the operations I participated in, and the eventual fallout. The whole operation consisted of infiltration by Scientology's Guardian's Office into various government, law enforcement, and other agencies. The purpose was to find and if possible eradicate files critical of L. Ron Hubbard. Most of those involved in this were later caught, charged, and convicted of their crimes. How did I slide out of that one? It was close.

episodes.title: Scientology said, "We'd rather have you dead..."
episodes.description:
A fanatical Scientologist following Scientology's policy literally threatened to kill me.

In this video, I'll cover what happened when a hard-core Scientologist who was following L. Ron Hubbard's policy called Keeping Scientology Working wants to take my life.

I was in Scientology for nearly 40 years. There was a lot of crazy during that time. Somehow the mental conditioning in the cult made it, not so much normal, but acceptable. I look back on that time and wonder how I put up with it.

This little story is one of the most bizarre things that happened to me in Scientology, but for whatever reason I had in my head, it didn't send me packing out of the cult at the time.

Timestamps:
00:00 Introduction
03:41 Keeping Scientology Working
04:40 We'd Rather Have You Dead Than Incapable
06:40 Supervisor Holding Lamp Over My Head
09:06 Why Didn't I Leave Scientology at That Point
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
